law.text: Every person to whom a city or county license is granted to carry on the business of a pawnbroker shall annually enter into bond to the city or county, with good and sufficient surety, to be approved by the city legislative body or the county fiscal court, in the penal sum of one thousand dollars ($1,000). The bond shall be conditioned that he will observe the provisions of KRS 226.030 to 226.050, and the ordinances and laws in force in the city or county not inconsistent with KRS 226.030 to 226.050.
law.history: Amended 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 237, sec. 1. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 3788.
